name: Esplanade River Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a spa suite for new years eve and were greeted by friendly staff at the front desk. The first thing I noticed was that neither the hallway nor our room were air conditioned so it was quite warm when we arrived. We had wall units which we switched on once inside.
reviews.title: Not very romantic

reviews.text: The second thing I noticed was that the entire bead head was broken and was leaning off the wall and against the bed. It wasn't subtly broken it was completely hanging and it would have been impossible for whoever made the bed not to notice. The spa was nice enough but it had a view of the washing maching which was crammed into the bathroom.
reviews.title: Very welcoming, and pleasantly suprised

reviews.text: This might be ok if you booked a serviced apartment but not for a romantic night in a spa suite. In my opinion the whole hotel needs a refurb.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this after seeing it advertised on TV with a 'summer package', we travel to Perth alot and use hotels 100% of the time, we quite often take advantages of specials, and have been very dissappointed on many occasions - cheap rates mean cheap rooms with no extras. Imagaine our suprise at a very pleasant reception area, nice staff and a tranquil feel to the whole hotel - despite it being right near the freeway!! a chilled bottle of champagne in our room on arrival was a great surprise. Room quiet, clean with everything we needed.
reviews.title: Didn't like this hotel

reviews.text: Minor problems with the room was that it was an odd shaped and they had tried to fit just a bit much furniture into it - to get to the bathroom there is squeezing room only between the bed and table and chairs, and the bathroom door is right by the side of the bed only a couple of feet away so if you go to the toilet/shower you constantly disturb the person on that side of the bed - but not much I gues they could do about it with the odd shape of the room.
reviews.title: It was great until house keeping didn't shut the door

reviews.text: Hotel situated about 2 miles from City Centre across the Swan River in a genteel residential district. ( Croquet and Royal Perth Golf Club around the corner)
reviews.title: Nice One

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in a one bedroom. Comes with microwave, kettle, toaster and fridge which allows some independence from hotel catering.
reviews.title: Relaxing, attractive apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as we stayed here previously, around 5 years ago and we were quite impressed, back then. In 5 years, the room rate has gone up quite a bit. We booked a deluxe type room this time.
reviews.title: Small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we found that the room that was given had an odd shape. The bathroom was big, but the shower did not have any compartment for soap. Water pressure was another problem, as it was lacking. I believe it was part of the water conservation program. Another thing is, the bathroom did not have enough lights. The ceiling lamp was not bright at all.
reviews.title: After the first five minutes our minds were made up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was OK, though not as comfortable as other 4 stars hotel. We had problem with the air conditioning system, unfortunately. It was set too close to the bed, hence we could hear the noise and feel the breeze. The window cannot be opened (due to security reason), so we had to have the air conditioning unit on as otherwise we wouldn't have enough air circulation.
reviews.title: Good alternative to the centre hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a small TV, not an LCD/plasma TV, but the old tube TV. It came with free to air TV, some Sky TV channels, and pay to view movies. Remote control was hard to control as we had to point rather upward direction to get the set functioning. TV was also affected by some noise.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Car park is not free. At $12.00 per night, it's quite expensive considering the hotel location is far from the city. Also, some hotel guests told us that we could park our car outside the hotel complex free of charge, very much within walking distance.
reviews.title: very Good

description: Esplanade River Suites is superbly nestled on the banks of Perth's spectacular Swan River just 5 minutes to the CBD in South Perth, with easy access to freeways North and South, Perth Zoo and local restaurants and cafes.Offering a choice of self contained and serviced Studio, One and Two Bedroom Apartments,all with spa baths and some with river, pool or parkland views.With extensive facilites available onsite including heated outdoor pool, fitness centre, conference and business facilities, secure car parking or free street parking and home to the Pagoda Restaurant & Bar, Esplanade River Suites is the perfect choice for the business or leisure traveller.
